channel.title: About InterMine on InterMine - data integration, analysis, and warehousing
channel.description: Recent content in About InterMine on InterMine - data integration, analysis, and warehousing

item.description: InterMine is part of the Micklem Lab, led by Gos Micklem. Gos is also director of the Cambridge Computational Biology Institute. Gos can often be found writing grants and winning Department of Genetics awards for enthusiastic lecturing. (He says that this was probably a statistical anomaly).

Computer Scientist with a M.Sc. in Data Science & Machine Learning. His interests span from Machine Learning applied to cancer bioinformatics to the handling of biomedical big data. Previously, Adri√°n has worked in a variety of places in both the private and public sectors, such as the Spanish National Supercomputing Center and the Spanish Council for Scientific Research. He also has participated as Google Summer of Code student with InterMine in 2018.

Software Engineer with 15+ years of experience in web applications development in a variety of industries. Experienced in J2EE open source frameworks, servers, libraries and web services. She joined the InterMine team in 2010, working for 3 years, primarily in the backend development, then she moved away to the game industry but she changed ideas very soon and came back thinking that genes and proteins are more fun than treasures and crowns!

A passionate programmer who ended up at Intermine by chance following his interest in Clojure(Script). Is mostly versed in frontend development, but doesn't mind as long as he gets to write code in a fun language.

Biologist/bioinformatician with over 10 years experience working with InterMine and complex biological data, she forms the liaison between the biology and the software development. Rachel also runs training workshops for InterMine users and provides help-desk support.

With InterMine since 2007, has worked mostly in the production of modMine (modENCODE project) and ThaleMine (Araport project). Likes databases and data visualization, has produced a music album of his compositions.

GSoC Organisation Admin, software engineer with a focus on front-end technologies such as Javascript, ClojureScript, and User Interfaces. May be spotted blogging, tweeting from her own account, @intermineorg, @gmodproject, or updating the InterMine homepage. Loves interacting with open source communities. She's also a Software Sustainability Institute Fellow, and is studying effects of community and usability on open source projects for an EngD with the University of Manchester. In her spare time you can find her running, cycling, or reading speculative fiction.
